snippet: The agreement to allow American and coalition troops to use bases in Turkey in order to fight Islamic State militants in Syria and Iraq came after two days of talks in the Turkish capital.
abstract: Defense Dept officials say Turkey will allow American and coalition troops to use its bases for operations against Islamic State militants in Syria and Iraq.

byline.original: By ERIC SCHMITT and KIRK SEMPLE
byline.contributor: Eric Schmitt reported from Washington, and Kirk Semple from Baghdad. Reporting was contributed by Brian Knowlton from Washington, Ali Hamza from Baghdad, and employees of The New York Times from Baquba and Anbar Province, Iraq.

lead_paragraph: The agreement to allow American and coalition troops to use bases in Turkey in order to fight Islamic State militants in Syria and Iraq came after two days of talks in the Turkish capital.

headline.main: U.S. Troops to Use Bases in Turkey
headline.print_headline: U.S. Troops to Use Bases in Turkey
